Class HourlyProgrammer

java.lang.Object
Programmer
HourlyProgrammer
All Implemented Interfaces:
Payme
public class HourlyProgrammer extends Programmer
File name: HourlyProgrammer.java Author: Wai Wai Chan, 041057469 Course: CST8284, Java Assignment: 23W Lab 6 Due Date: 31 Mar 2023 Professor: David Houtman Description: This class provides methods to print out a hourly programmer's information and calculate their payment due and income tax amount.
Author:
Wai Wai Chan

  • Constructor Details

    • HourlyProgrammer

      public HourlyProgrammer(String firstName, String lastName, String socialSecurityNumber, double wage, double hours)
      Parameterized constructor to construct a Hourly Programmer with passed first name, last name, social security number, wage, and hours.
      Parameters:
      firstName - the first name for this Hourly Programmer
      lastName - the last name for this Hourly Programmer
      socialSecurityNumber - the social security number for this Hourly Programmer
      wage - the wage for this Hourly Programmer
      hours - the hours for this Hourly Programmer
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the hourly wage is smaller than zero
      IllegalArgumentException - if hours is smaller than zero or greater than 168

  • Method Details

    • setWage

      public void setWage(double wage)
      Sets the wage for the Hourly Programmer. This method guarantees the input wage must be greater than or equal to zero, otherwise throw exception. However, this method hasn't check if the input wage should be a double and should not be something other than that, for example: a string.
      Parameters:
      wage - the wage for this hourly programmer
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the hourly wage is smaller than zero

    • getWage

      public double getWage()
      Returns the wage of Hourly Programmer. The result of the getter hasn't been checked for valid input, having the possibility of returning the unexpected result.
      Returns:
      wage the wage of the hourly programmer

    • setHours

      public void setHours(double hours)
      Sets the Hours for this hourly programmer. The setter guarantees the input hours must be between 0 and 168, otherwise throw exception. However, the setter hasn't check if the input wage should be a double and should not be something other than that, for example: a string.
      Parameters:
      hours - the hours for hourly programmer
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if hours is smaller than zero or greater than 168

    • getHours

      public double getHours()
      Returns hours worked of Hourly Programmer.The result of the getter hasn't been checked for valid input, having the possibility of returning the unexpected result.
      Returns:
      hours the hours worked of the hourly programmer

    • getPaymentAmount

      public double getPaymentAmount()
      This method calculates and returns the payment due amount of this hourly programmer, by multiplying hourly wage by worked hours. If worked hours exceed 40 hours, the part of worked hours which exceeds 40 hours will get 50% extra pay.
      Specified by:
      getPaymentAmount in interface Payme
      Specified by:
      getPaymentAmount in class Programmer
      Returns:
      the payment due amount of hourly programmer

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation for the first name, last name, social security number, hourly wage, and worked hours of hourly Programmer.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Programmer
      Returns:
      a string representation showing first name, last name, social security number, hourly wage, and worked hours

    • display

      public double display()
      Returns the income tax amount of hourly programmer by multiply payment due amount by 30%.
      Specified by:
      display in interface Payme
      Specified by:
      display in class Programmer
      Returns:
      a double representing income tax amount which is 30% of the payment due amount
